questions.Q: Two bodies of mass $$m=\,\text{kg}$$ and $$M=2\,\text{kg}$$ are connected by a light inextensible string which passes through a smooth fixed pulley. If the fricction is neglected the tension of the string is:
questions.E: The forces acting upon each body are displayed in the diagram. After applying the Newton's second law to each body we have: $$T=ma$$ and $$Mg-T=Ma$$. From these equations it follows that $$T=\frac{mM}{m+M}g=\frac{(2\,\text{kg})(3\,\text{kg})}{2\,\text{kg}+3\,\text{kg}}g=\frac{2}{3}g$$.
